Sydney deportment coach polished Denmark's next queen on royal journeyAustralian-born Mary Donaldson, who will become Queen of Denmark on Sunday when her husband, Crown Prince Frederik, ascends the throne, has been recognised as one of the world’s most sophisticated and well-dressed people. Wed, 10 Jan 2024 04:47:07 GMT VLTMBQ4XERMVPOIWKRTRRDRV7I https://www.reuters.com/world/sydney-deportment-coach-polished-denmarks-next-queen-royal-journey-2024-01-10/Cordelia Hsu世界
Indonesia, Philippines discuss South China Sea developments - MarcosThe leaders of the Philippines and Indonesia met on Wednesday to discuss a range of regional issues including developments in the South China Sea and closer cooperation among member states of the Southeast Asian bloc. Wed, 10 Jan 2024 03:59:31 GMT 7Q33CV3W3JPAXCVDLE7LA633UU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/indonesia-philippines-discuss-south-china-sea-developments-marcos-2024-01-10/Reuters世界亚太地区
Liberal PDP wins parliamentary elections in Bhutan - provisional vote tallyA liberal political party led by a former prime minister was set to form a new government in Bhutan after winning its fourth free vote since democratic elections began 15 years ago, provisional results by the country's election body showed on Wednesday. Wed, 10 Jan 2024 03:49:29 GMT L64L65NUL5KNHBCBBLTVHMVDDU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/liberal-pdp-wins-parliamentary-elections-bhutan-provisional-vote-tally-2024-01-10/Gopal Sharma世界亚太地区

Key facts on Taiwan-China relations ahead of Taiwan electionsTaiwan goes to the polls on Saturday to elect a new president and parliament. China, which considers Taiwan merely a Chinese province and part of its territory despite the objections of the island's government, will be watching the outcome closely. Taiwan to vote in what China calls 'peace and war' electionTaiwan goes to the polls on Saturday to elect a new president and parliament under the shadow of an increasingly assertive China which has called the vote a choice between peace and war. Taiwan's de facto ambassador to US meets US House speakerTaiwan's de facto ambassador to the United States met on Tuesday with U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson, Taiwan's foreign ministry said on Wednesday. US, UK forces shoot down Houthi missiles, drones in Red Sea -US militaryU.S. and UK forces shot down 21 drones and missiles fired by Yemen-based Houthis on Tuesday into the Southern Red Sea towards international shipping lanes, the U.S. military's Central Command said. White House: US vice president's plane diverted because of stormU.S. Vice President Kamala Harris's plane, Air Force Two, was diverted on its way back from Atlanta on Tuesday because of weather conditions, her office said. China satellite launch causes pre-election political storm in TaiwanThe launch of a Chinese satellite that flew over Taiwan, prompting an erroneous air raid alert, sparked a political storm on the island on Wednesday about China's motives only days out from presidential elections.
